items.title: Why Pharma and Biotech Stocks Got Thrashed on Tuesday
items.author: Eric Volkman
items.description: Biotech and pharmaceutical stocks fell sharply on Tuesday amid concerns over potential tariffs on the industry by the Trump administration. While some positive news emerged, such as Merck's licensing deal, the overall sentiment was negative due to the uncertainty surrounding the proposed tariffs.

insights.sentiment_reasoning: Amgen's stock declined by more than 2% due to the broader market sell-off in the biotech and pharmaceutical sectors caused by concerns over potential tariffs.
Regeneron Pharmaceuticals' stock fell by more than 4% due to the broader market sell-off in the biotech and pharmaceutical sectors caused by concerns over potential tariffs.

Merck signed a deal to license a potential blockbuster heart disease drug from its Chinese peer Jiangsu Hengrui Pharmaceuticals, which could be worth up to almost $2 billion, indicating a positive development for the company.
Axsome Therapeutics' stock declined by nearly 7% due to the broader market sell-off in the biotech and pharmaceutical sectors caused by concerns over potential tariffs.
